name: Transpose
prompt:
# Instructions

Given an input text output it transposed.

Roughly explained, the transpose of a matrix:

```text
ABC
DEF
```

is given by:

```text
AD
BE
CF
```

Rows become columns and columns become rows.
See [transpose][].

If the input has rows of different lengths, this is to be solved as follows:

- Pad to the left with spaces.
- Don't pad to the right.

Therefore, transposing this matrix:

```text
ABC
DE
```

results in:

```text
AD
BE
C
```

And transposing:

```text
AB
DEF
```

results in:

```text
AD
BE
 F
```

In general, all characters from the input should also be present in the transposed output.
That means that if a column in the input text contains only spaces on its bottom-most row(s), the corresponding output row should contain the spaces in its right-most column(s).

[transpose]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transpose

Place the implementation in src/core/transpose.py
test_file:
import pytest
import sys
sys.path.insert(0, 'src')
from core.transpose import *

# These tests are auto-generated with test data from:
# https://github.com/exercism/problem-specifications/tree/main/exercises/transpose/canonical-data.json
# File last updated on 2023-07-19

import unittest

from transpose import (
transpose,
)



def test_empty_string():
    lines = []
    expected = []
    assert transpose("\n".join(lines)) == "\n".join(expected)

def test_two_characters_in_a_row():
    lines = ["A1"]
    expected = ["A", "1"]
    assert transpose("\n".join(lines)) == "\n".join(expected)

def test_two_characters_in_a_column():
    lines = ["A", "1"]
    expected = ["A1"]
    assert transpose("\n".join(lines)) == "\n".join(expected)

def test_simple():
    lines = ["ABC", "123"]
    expected = ["A1", "B2", "C3"]
    assert transpose("\n".join(lines)) == "\n".join(expected)

def test_single_line():
    lines = ["Single line."]
    expected = ["S", "i", "n", "g", "l", "e", " ", "l", "i", "n", "e", "."]
    assert transpose("\n".join(lines)) == "\n".join(expected)

def test_first_line_longer_than_second_line():
    lines = ["The fourth line.", "The fifth line."]
    expected = [
        "TT",
        "hh",
        "ee",
        "  ",
        "ff",
        "oi",
        "uf",
        "rt",
        "th",
        "h ",
        " l",
        "li",
        "in",
        "ne",
        "e.",
        ".",
    ]
    assert transpose("\n".join(lines)) == "\n".join(expected)

def test_second_line_longer_than_first_line():
    lines = ["The first line.", "The second line."]
    expected = [
        "TT",
        "hh",
        "ee",
        "  ",
        "fs",
        "ie",
        "rc",
        "so",
        "tn",
        " d",
        "l ",
        "il",
        "ni",
        "en",
        ".e",
        " .",
    ]
    assert transpose("\n".join(lines)) == "\n".join(expected)

def test_mixed_line_length():
    lines = ["The longest line.", "A long line.", "A longer line.", "A line."]
    expected = [
        "TAAA",
        "h   ",
        "elll",
        " ooi",
        "lnnn",
        "ogge",
        "n e.",
        "glr",
        "ei ",
        "snl",
        "tei",
        " .n",
        "l e",
        "i .",
        "n",
        "e",
        ".",
    ]
    assert transpose("\n".join(lines)) == "\n".join(expected)

def test_square():
    lines = ["HEART", "EMBER", "ABUSE", "RESIN", "TREND"]
    expected = ["HEART", "EMBER", "ABUSE", "RESIN", "TREND"]
    assert transpose("\n".join(lines)) == "\n".join(expected)

def test_rectangle():
    lines = ["FRACTURE", "OUTLINED", "BLOOMING", "SEPTETTE"]
    expected = ["FOBS", "RULE", "ATOP", "CLOT", "TIME", "UNIT", "RENT", "EDGE"]
    assert transpose("\n".join(lines)) == "\n".join(expected)

def test_triangle():
    lines = ["T", "EE", "AAA", "SSSS", "EEEEE", "RRRRRR"]
    expected = ["TEASER", " EASER", "  ASER", "   SER", "    ER", "     R"]
    assert transpose("\n".join(lines)) == "\n".join(expected)

def test_jagged_triangle():
    lines = ["11", "2", "3333", "444", "555555", "66666"]
    expected = ["123456", "1 3456", "  3456", "  3 56", "    56", "    5"]
    assert transpose("\n".join(lines)) == "\n".join(expected)
